meanings.definition: The charge or fee for a service, especially in gambling.
meanings.sent1: The vig for playing poker was too high for me to afford.
meanings.sent2: He paid the vig before starting the game of blackjack.
meanings.sent3: The casino owner joked that the vig was so high, it felt like winning was impossible.
meanings.sent4: The vig seemed like a small price to pay for the excitement of the game.
meanings.sent5: The vig was like a toll booth on the road to winning big.

meanings.sent3: The cat decided to vig the fish tank, just in case.
meanings.sent4: He vowed to vig over his little sister at the crowded fair.
meanings.sent5: The knight would vig the castle walls with unwavering dedication.

meanings.definition: To stay awake, especially for a long period of time.
meanings.sent1: I had to vig all night to finish my project on time.
meanings.sent2: The doctor had to vig for hours during the emergency surgery.
meanings.sent3: She would vig until dawn studying for her final exams.
meanings.sent4: The soldier had to vig through the night to protect his comrades.
meanings.sent5: The detective would vig for days on end to solve the case.
